item.title: Kubernetes on Coreos
item.description: Kubernetes is an open-source system for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications. I just follow the guide of CoreOS + Kubernetes Step By Step to deploy Kubernetes cluster on CoreOS. Although this guide is detailed, there’s still something that will cause misunderstanding and should be paid close attention to. So this post is to help you better follow the guide and setup Kubernetes. First of all, according to CoreOS cluster architectures, the CoreOS + Kubernetes Step By Step guide is for Easy development/testing cluster or Production cluster with central services, however, what I have is a Small cluster which was set up in the way Setup CoreOS Cluster with Static IPs, that will make some difference to ETCD_ENDPOINTS environment variable.
